Don't dare say you'd die if I stopped talking to you, because you still draw breath.  And you dont' miss me enough to stay single.  Quite frankly, you don't have a damn clue what you want.  Don't give me a matter-a-factly when the only fact is that I dont matter.  I did'nt 'give up'.  I gave in.  All my friends told me you were posion, I didn't believe them, I didn't believe you made me your 'yo-yo'.  I didn't want to admit to my parents it was over, because I didn't believe it.  I made you promise you wouldn't drink so long as we were going out.  Let a promise keep you from what you want to do.  It's null and void, no more.  Drink your saddness away, you'll only be crying it back out.  Live your own life.  You didn't want just 'one man in your life'.  So find company with every cock bearing man in this world.  Every single one, everyone but me.  And he continues his journey, Xylothin in hand...   Endless Waltz... - 5/19/2004 With each passing year, the excitement of a birthday, the anticipation, fades away.  Maybe my life is just becoming one big routine, eventually to be halted by the phenomenon called death.  The same holds true for Christmas.  Santa either died, or I'm just growing up.  I had a shitty birthday.  Friday May 14th, 2004 2:30 PM CST: After one of my final days of my shortlived junior year, I made my way to Target so I could switch schedules with Rand.  He apparently had some band thing on my birthday, so I got the opportunity to work for him.  "come in at 4:00 pm" they said.  (Well okay, that gives me enough time to sleep in and what not).  I leave, get home and dawn the suit I got for Christmas, I looked damn pimp.  Figured I should head over to the Hilton Hotel early and help set up the "Red Carpet Affair" because I failed to make this gay poster thing.  Got there around 4:30, only person dressed up.  I helped put a few things together, not much else.  RCA was basically a talent show/dance/awards ceremony.  Originally I had intended to take Jackie to this thing.  Well, I also originally had intended to go out with this women for more than a week.  Apparently I made up some bullshit lie like I was working that day so we couldnt go.  (she still wanted to go AFTER breaking up with me, how bout dem apples?).  Well I had a free ticket so Vanessa picked it up.  She rode with Chris.  The whole deal was entertaining enough.  Everyone started dancing to rap, so I exited temporarily.  I sat down in a chair outside the reserved room and stared into the night sky.  it was about 8:30 or 9.  I got to have one of my all too infrequent moments of self contemplation.  They are always very calming.  It's basically just stepping out of your body and analyzing why you are the way you are.  What makes me tick.  I think I'm a good person.  i'd like to think I'm a work in progress, someone who wants to better himself.  I also came into that sense of doubt that's ever lingering in my mind.  I wish I was more charsimatic.  I have some big shoes to fill next year in PoP, but also some holes to fill in.  I suppose my main thought was trying to not be exclusive and hateful like our current senior regime is.  It's half trickled down to the juniors, but the sophmores are just great.  Hopefully I can extinguish that flame next year.  RCA came to a close, and still feeling as though I had not contributed anything to it, offered to help take it down for Matt and the rest of the crew.  I did more manual labor that night than I ever intend to ever again.  I hauled more than 5X my weight, not saying that much, but still.  It was about midnight and I decided to help take everything from the Hilton hotel back to church.  By this time I was the only youth left, it was just Matt, Mr. Jones (AWESOME GUY) Mr. Carpenter (meh, he's an aggie) and me.  Just as we finished putting hte last few things in the youth room, I looked at my cell phone and said to myself "well crap, I'm 17 now".  No one noticed, no happy birthday.  I was a little upset.  Saturday May 15th, 2003 12:20pm CST:  I'm freaking tired,  my arms hurt, and I hear my phone vibrating.  Oh look, its my favorite place of employment, Target.  "yes, well, we need you to come in around 1:00pm for more training".  Thanks for the heads up.  I make my way downstairs for breakfast, sulking and angry.  Mom didnt know I was going to work early until i was out the door.  No matter.  Greg had called and said he couldnt come down for my birthday since I was working.  I was a little upset.  When I got to work, Tiffane' had called to wish me a happy birthday.  "Well, I just called to say happy birthday, I'll bet you're having a lot of fun right now".  Ha, I laughed so hard when I heard her voicemail.  Nate and Chuck dropped by Target around 7 to give me my Bday present.  Then they fucked with my cart.  i was a little pissed off.  Chuck was squeezing his nipple.  that was gross, yet slightly humorous.  So i freaking worked, for 9 hours on my birthday.  And outside of my immediate family, 5 people remembered.  Damn horrible day.  Well, as Jake once said, "A long enough timeline kills anything".  That seems very relevent, what me talking about aging and all.  meh, I guess you really only age if you are forgotten.  Enough timeline can defeat all things, even life... Why get up... - 5/26/2004 Why keep fighting? For a long time now I have tried to become a chasteful and moral individual.  I have done my best to abstain from lust, drinking and other temptations which I know to be wrong.  What good has this noble sacrifice gotten me?  'It's really attractive to have stayed a virgin this long, Bryan' Jayci tells me.  Wow, look how many unnattractive people there are in this world then.  And look at how few there will be when I tie the knot.  "Don't you ever just want to go out and have fun.  Lose control?" Yes.  At times my morale and resolve is low.  At times I want to shed my ethics and simply 'live for the moment'.  But nay, I refuse to believe that doing something so selfish is worthwhile.  Yet, in a world where that is but the norm, what good is it?  I ask for justification of my own actions.  Someone explain to me why I dont go out and have fun like the rest.  Why do I not do these things when I am not a role model.  When my actions are not regarded highly in any form or fashion.  Why carry this cross, that so many others have abandoned?  Maybe I'm wrong.  Maybe going out, becoming intoxicated and making out with some person you just met is holy and moral.  Maybe everything I've ever lived my life for is but a deception.  Maybe Love is just some insipid invention.  Some febel construct of a weak human intelect.  But maybe I'm right.  I just want to know why I am, and what worth it is to be right.  What good is a Paladin when his castle crumbles around him?  What good is an ethical person when ethics cease to be? Do you believe you're fighting for something... Waltz for Venus... - 5/26/2004 I sit here at my computer gazing at His Dark Materials.  A Trilogy I recently purchased at the inspiration of my friends Jake and Nathan.  I can recall, last year Jake having just finished reading it, explaining what a great trilogy it is, how it has a fantastic love story.  Once more I gaze at the books, and above the title it clearly displays the books' genre.  'Fantasy'. It's all, just a dream.  Love, that ever elusive Unicorn.  Just over the horizon.  Perhaps it is just a fantasy.  Perhaps this journey has been nothing more than an Odyssey without an Ithaka.  So I sit here, staring blankly at my computer screen, words appearing at my very will.  Only words.  Not everyone gets married.  Not everyone finds love.  Few I suppose do.  How lucky they must be, do they even realize it?  Again I see people who are constantly in a relationship, rarely with the same person.  Does that mean anything?  Is that love, does that make them happy?  It wouldn't make me happy, that much is true.  Sure, the void would be filled, but with each passing girlfriend.  With each passing love, that void would only swell. See you space cowboy...

Today at work (Nesbits today), I realized just how much I hate my last name. Honeycutt. It's hard not to make fun of that name. My friends all have cool names. Cooper, Thompson, Hartman, etc. The only insult for cooper is poopers cooper, which was uttered by Alice McDonald, only because everything she says needs to be accompanied by one. Because all she says is s**t basically. So this big black lady goes, 'hey bryan... uh, honeycomb? Uh, honeysomething?'. I hate myself. And i'm putting up all these clothes that belong to people with freaking awesome last names. I'd give an arm and a leg to have names like some people have: Valore, Machines, Terranova. Freaking awesome names. I am forced to live in perpetual angst and self hate...
